intro: Noccaea elegans, commonly known as the velvetleaf or silverleaf, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is characterized by its finely hairy, silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in early summer. Noccaea elegans thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or rocky habitats. Its unique appearance and ecological adaptations make it a notable species in its native range.
